[Rabbit reputation increased]
"Fantastic! I'll show them how to plant it, at least, as far as I've been told. I shall return eagerly once it's had a chance to grow!"

"Greetings! I come asking a favor a long time in the making. There is a plant, known to my people as 'Heirbloom', which has not been grown for a long time. It needs the sun to flourish, and we've been unable to stay aboveground long enough to tend it for many years."

"These seeds have been passed down in my warren for generations, and I would be grateful, and honored, if you could grow them for us."

msg1.choice_000: Exciting! Our farmers would be happy to.

bulletin_message.000: "Awww... alright, I might come back later." They wander off, clearly pouting.
bulletin_message.001: "I see, sorry to bother you. Maybe send word if more sprouts up?"

bulletin_message.000: A Rabbit approaches, cautious but friendly. "Hello, um, I heard Sasha got that Heirbloom from you. Could I trade you for some?"
bulletin_message.001: A Rabbit finds her way into town, on the lookout for anything nasty. "Dear humans, could I perhaps trade you for some Heirbloom? It's ever so tasty, and Sasha told us we should come get to know you better..."

bulletin_message.00:
"Ahh, the full brilliance of an Amberstone is a sight to behold! Thank you for your kind service, take these in thanks."

[Rabbit reputation increased]
"I understand. Perhaps next time. Farewell, humans."

"Charging them is simple - just place them anywhere in sunlight or moonlight, and they will gather energy on their own."

"The... only issue is that creatures tend to be attracted to the Amberstones at night. So, either prepare to defend against them, or be sure to take the crystals down before nightfall."
"Splendid, I'll lay the Charging Stones by your banner. I'll return for them once they've been deployed and gathering light for long enough - sunlight or moonlight, it all comes from the same place."

"Greetings, kind humans. As you know, we live undergound, and because of that we rely on Amberstone, our namesake material, for many things."

"Amberstones can absorb many kinds of energy, sunlight being one of them - and these stones here have lost their glow."

"In Rabbit culture, when a new warren is dug, it exchanges statues with its neighbors to symbolize a mutual welcoming. We know you are unaware of this, but have come to offer this for our part"

Sasha gestures to the beautifully chiseled statue of smooth, cool stone ornamented with intricate weavings and a golden core of what must be Amberstone.

"This partnership somewhat unprecedented, but we think that you may represent hope for us against the coming darkness."

"You shall see us again soon! Oh, and feel free to keep the cricket golem, it would slow me down on the return trip. Farewell!"

Sasha Lightfoot approaches, a small load-bearing stone insect bobbling along behind him. "Friends! Not long ago, my kind were afraid of you kin of Monkey, but you have dissolved our purposeless trepidation! We have found in you a dependable ally in the aboveground!"

msg1.choice_002: It's been nice knowing you as well

bulletin_message.00:
"I will leave this Amberstone Pedestal. Build or choose a nice home with two beds, and place this pedestal there. Once all is prepared, I will return with my kin!

Place the Amberstone Pedestal near two beds, with a high enough appeal - check the name of the placed item for live updates!
Sasha nods. "Very well. They will no doubt be disappointed, but it will bring me some comfort to have them settle closer to the safety of the warren."

"Splendid! Some accomodations must first be made. You see, the Amberstone crystals are more than a mere light source - they are also what keeps us from reverting to the simple animals you see hopping around the surface."

"Never fear, such a process takes considerable time. All the same, a Rabbit home would not be comfortable without an Amberstone at its center."
"So, a pair of my more adventurous kin are interested in immigrating to the aboveground. In fact, they specifically asked me to ask you if you might have a place for them here."

msg1.choice_000: Yes, we would love to have them!
msg1.choice_001: No - but we wish them the best!

21_residents_reward_a_add_citizen.notification_title: A Rabbit Mason joins your town!

21b_residents_reward_a_add_citizen.notification_title: A Rabbit Archer joins your town!

21c_residents_reward_a_add_citizen.notification_title: A Rabbit Worker joins your town!

bulletin_message.00: "What a nice home you've built for them! They will be here shortly, and I'm sure they'll be charmed!"

"It's working! The weapon is charging!!"

"Hold off whatever foul tricks the Titan has in store for us, and I'll let you know when it's ready to fire!"
"It's charged again! Fire at will!"
"It's charged!!! Fire at will!" Sasha shouts at you, covering his sensitive ears.

Sasha leaps into the air in excitement. "Direct hit!!! Take that, you big ugly squid!"

Calming down a little, he turns to you. "It will take time to recharge - I'll let you know when it's ready again. Keep up the defense, we must stay standing."

Sasha's features soften and his shoulders relax, an enormous weight clearly lifted from him. He speaks, ears folded subtly back and eyes glistening:

"Listen, I... thank you. Thank you. I have spent so much time worrying about my people's future, and you... you are proof that we can have one. That we can have a good one. We are forever in your debt."

"Thank you, and may your future be even brighter than ours."

conclusion_accept.choice_000: We merely repaid our peoples' debt to yours.
conclusion_accept.choice_001: We are honored to have helped.

request2.choice_001: No, but they have our thanks

bulletin_message.00:
Sasha nods his head. "While Human cleverness brought the entity, human cleverness also forestalled its cataclysm. As the entity tore open the leyline, the surviving humans knew they had to act, as the great evil was bathed in magic and growing in strength by the second."

"Hearth's magic is volatile. The humans, desperate, somehow catalyzed a reaction which turned the magic energy into pure magic force."

"The entity was shattered into countless fragments, not killed but, rather, transformed into a miasma of aimless evil that swept over the land, emanating from the ravaged crater that was once the seat of the Phoenix Empire."

"This is what we know as 'the cataclysm'."

"So - an eon passed; Snake declined, Monkey Ascended. Some say Monkey is a newcomer, and snatched Ascendancy from Snake early, but thats another story. Either way, Humans built with startling speed, and the Phoenix Empire spanned the continent within three generations."

"Unsatisfied with mere subsistence underground, my ancestors contacted the Phoenix, who proved amenable to us."

"In fact, our teachings of Geomancy fascinated them. As is their nature, the Phoenix researchers made fast progress in utilizing Hearths magic, without truly understanding it. They put it to use without any concern for consequences."

Sasha nods, sighing. "I understand; each warren has challenges of its own to face. Still, we will find a way to complete work on the Titan weapon on our own, and return with it once it is ready."

"May our friendship continue to blossom," he says, bowing slightly and taking his leave.

"Recall what I told you before, of my people's rise when Rabbit was in Ascendance, of the discovery of Geomancy and amberstone that allows us to keep this upright form even once Snake Ascended and Rabbit waned."

"I told you, too, of how my clan took to living underground, driven by both hostility and a lack of magic on Hearth's surface. That's where I left off, correct?"

"The Phoenix capital was built on the ruins of an ancient Lapine city, which was in turn built on a nexus of Leylines. This meant it was an enormously powerful wellspring of magic."

"Human Geomancy researchers built devices to extract this magic; to store it and focus it beyond anything we had ever imagined possible, and well beyond the bounds of safety or sanity. And then, a portal was opened."

"Nobody knows if it was intentional, or if the strain of all that channeled magic simply tore a hole in reality. What we do know is that an entity was drawn through it, ravenous for magical energy and abhorrent of all other life."

"So now, to the favor. There is, beneath this land, a nascent Titan. This fragment of the great evil grows, seeping farther underground more each year, forcing my people farther and farther underground to not be cut off from the magic of Hearth and be doomed to have our descendants revert to mere rabbits."

"But: we have found an answer. We have nearly completed construction of a weapon drawn from ancient designs, capable of manifesting the Titan, and capable of destroying it for good."

"However, we require your help in finishing it, and we require your town to protect it. We lack the strength or the numbers to withstand the wrath of a manifested Titan for long, and this weapon will take time to do its job. Will you help us?"

favor1.choice_000: What do you need from us?

bulletin_message.00:
Sasha's eyes sparkle, full of relief and gratitude. "I was right to have put my trust in you. Please, prepare your citizens to visit with us for a time, and I will return with the finished device in time."

"Perhaps use this time to store some food, shore up your defenses, and train your military. Perhaps enlist some citizens in a town guard, or build a fortified structure? One cannot be sure in what form the Titan's ire will manifest."

"Dear friends of the Monkey, I bring greetings and well wishes from the twenty-third warren of Amberstone."

"I have a momentous favor to ask of you, but I think perhaps you lack the context to understand it. Am I right that the history of the Phoenix Empire became lost to you humans after the cataclysm?"

"Humans, sensible, fled; to the coasts, to the northern mountains. Only recently have you started to build inwards again. Orcs, stubborn, stayed and fought the corruptions, fought the apparitions of a natural world brought to anger, defending the lands abandoned by the humans. And we Lapine, already underground, were content to wait."

"But as the evil energies settled, they embedded in the ground, drawn downwards towards the source of Hearths magic. These fragments absorb that magic, slowly gaining strength over generations, congealing into malevolent aspects which your people have come to call Titans."

Sasha nods, exhaling deeply. "I understand. 'If a favor is not asked lightly, neither is it accepted lightly'. Our current warren will continue to serve for years yet before the darkness encroaches.

"We will complete work on the Titan weapon on our own, and then return. Hopefully you will have a change of heart. May our friendship continue to blossom," he says, with both sadness and sincerity, and takes his leave.

"First, I will need to borrow some of your citizens: One experienced Mason to double-check our work, an experienced Blacksmith to help with reinforcement, plus two other citizens of your choosing to... help reach the tall parts."

"With that complete, we will return with the weapon, and once you have prepared, we will use it to summon, attack, and destroy the Titan. The attack may take some significant time, so you should prepare for a siege."

"I should say... this evil is of no immediate threat to you. This is a task to benefit your people's children, and mine."

Sasha returns, along with a massive, sparkling bow teetering precariously atop a skittering golem.

"I know you previously declined to assist us with fighting the Titan," he says, "but we completed this Arbalest despite your refusal. It took sacrifice, but we knew not what else to do."

"It serves no use within our warren, so we have brought it here as a reminder of our request. If you decide to face the slumbering evil, merely deploy the Crystalline Arbalest and I will instruct you further.

Sasha returns, along with a massive, sparkling bow teetering precariously atop a skittering golem.

"It took sacrifice, but we have completed the Crystalline Arbalest to the specifications of my ancestors. I... hope it works."

"If you are still open to fighting this monstrosity, signal your readiness by deploying the Arbalest, and I'll instruct you in its usage."

Sasha returns, followed by your dispatched citizens and a massive, sparkling bow balanced atop a skittering golem.

"I have returned, not only with your citizens, but with a completed Crystalline Arbalest, built to the specifications of my ancestors. I... hope it works."

"Signal your readiness by deploying it, and I'll instruct you in its usage."
The Rabbit Geomancer brought some Hearthbloom, Hearth Essence, and raw materials along with them, to help start their new aboveground practice.

50_titan_weapon_quest.title: A Titanic Undertaking
50_titan_weapon_quest.text: Choose a Mason (Lv4), Blacksmith (Lv4), plus any two other citizens to help Clan Amberstone

bulletin_message.00: "Splendid! I think even a novice Mason and Weaver would work just fine, so long as they're receptive to teaching. It shouldn't take more than two days."
"Hum. Well, I suppose maybe I still have much to learn about human aesthetics after all..."

"Kind greetings, human friends! I was struck by an idea after watching your crafters at work - how would you like to send a Mason and a Weaver down to our warren for a few days, to learn our various crafting recipes and techniques?"

"Oh. I thought it was a clever idea, myself."

"Are you certain? I'll not offer again, you see."

reject.choice_000: Nah, not a fan of your style

bulletin_message.00:
Your venturing Mason and Weaver have returned, with knowledge of all sorts of Rabbit recipes!

"I must say, your citizens shared tales of the poh-yoh paht-pai with us. I simply must try it sometime..."

msg1.choice_000: It's good to have them back - thank you!

promote_carpenter.text: On Hearing the Call of the Saw:

lovable_rogue.000: You want me to be the carpenter? Can I... sell the stuff I make? Or is this communal property?

diligent_sweetheart.000: Me? You want me to be the carpenter? Ok, I'll do my best!

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: The Saw? Where some people see a tool, I see a serrated weapon. Saw, you are my new best friend.

insufferable_academic.000: I shall endeavor to bring the music of the cubes to our furniture.

hopeless_optimist.000: Me, Carpenter? YES!! I've always wanted to make miniature chairs!!!

beleaguered_leader.000: It is my turn to wield the saw. Too bad mom always said I was bad with power.
Today, we're chopping trees for wood. I'm already sick of the wood jokes.
beleaguered_leader.001: Timbeerrrrr!!! I could get used to saying that.
beleaguered_leader.002: The gang's keeping track of who's chopped down the most trees. It's me but in the time it would take to correct their math I'd rather just add another tree to my total.
beleaguered_leader.003: Thought I saw a hornet's nest while we were logging. Luckily, everyone got out of the way in time.
beleaguered_leader.004: Wood: our eternal taskmaster. Got to keep our eye on the goal.
beleaguered_leader.005: Everyone chop together! Chop! Chop! Chop! Yes, hurry too!
beleaguered_leader.006: Ok gang, breaktime's over. Back to chopping!
beleaguered_leader.007: Every time I swing this axe, I visualize my dream house and exactly how I'm going to build it. Side effect of all this chopping: the floorplan's getting smaller.

teacher.000: Attacked more trees today. By [str(entry.teacher)] there's a lot of trees out here.

lovable_rogue.000: Step 1: Chop wood. Step 2: ???. Step 3: Profit!! Hm. Still working on step 2.
lovable_rogue.001: I would be more excited to chop trees if they had a discernible anatomy. Or if I could get combat advantage! Or if they could be flanked. Or if they even just had facing, so I could backstab! Not that I ever heard of anyone felling a tree with a backstab.
lovable_rogue.002: My hands are getting rough from all this chopping.
lovable_rogue.003: Top reason chopping trees is fun: perfecting the swing of the axe. May be useful one day!
lovable_rogue.004: Top reason carrying wood is fun: can't think of one.
lovable_rogue.005: I wonder how much I could sell this wood for back home. ...Nothing, probably.
lovable_rogue.006: I wonder if I could get out of chopping wood by pretending to have a splinter? Oh right, it wouldn't be pretending.
lovable_rogue.007: Ow! Blister! Why am I doing this to myself? An at-will employment contract is pretty much beside the point when you're OUT IN THE MIDDLE OF NOWHERE.
lovable_rogue.008: Splinters! Everywhere! Ok, calming breath. Calming breath. Anyone got tweezers?

psychopathic_misanthrope.002: Spork those trees, you know? Just spork them all!
psychopathic_misanthrope.003: I've chopped about a billion trees today. Call me axe murderer!!!
psychopathic_misanthrope.004: People say I have deep-seated aggression problems, but nobody complains about all the wood I produce
psychopathic_misanthrope.005: Is anyone else chopping these trees? It it just me?
psychopathic_misanthrope.006: Glad I'm doing something so physical. Sitting and knitting all day would drive me crazy.

hopeless_optimist.000: Chop chop chop! If you say it over and over, it's almost like a song!
hopeless_optimist.001: Chopping wood builds muscles! Note to self: see if anyone's noticed.
hopeless_optimist.002: We're sorry Mr. Tree, but we have to cut you down so we can live inside of you. But we won't ever forget that we're warm and safe thanks to your sacrifice.
hopeless_optimist.003: There's something really satisfying about cutting down something so much bigger than me!
hopeless_optimist.004: I'm Paul Revere! I mean, Bunyon!
hopeless_optimist.005: How much wood would a woodchuck chuck, if a woodchuck could chuck wood? Well if my name were Woodchuck, the answer would be: lots! Note to self: find out later what a woodchuck looks like.
hopeless_optimist.006: Lumber lumber lumber, must be lumber, in a woodman's world. Ah-aaaa, all the things I could do, if I had a little lumber, it's a woodman's worrrllld. Ahhh-AAAAAIIEEE---FALLING TREEEE!!!!!
hopeless_optimist.007: I hear I'm not supposed to sing anymore when I'm chopping trees. Whatever!
hopeless_optimist.008: Oh no! Mr. Squirrel! I'm so sorry. I didn't mean to cut down your house. Tell you what--move in with me! Nuts are on the house. Oh. I probably shouldn't have mentioned the house...

insufferable_academic.000: This is an appalling underutilization of my keen mental faculties.
insufferable_academic.001: If I never see another axe again it will be too soon.
insufferable_academic.002: This might almost be worth the effort if only the lumber were destined for a paper mill.
insufferable_academic.003: Is there no one else who could engage in such menial labor?
insufferable_academic.004: I have perfected a mathematically ideal chopping motion. Alas, there are no peer-reviewed journals here in which I might publish my findings.
insufferable_academic.005: I cannot help but feel the necessity to mention the alarming rate at which we are deforesting the entire region... What? No, of course I'm not trying to avoid lumber duties!

diligent_sweetheart.000: I guess I can learn to chop down trees if that's what needs to be done.
diligent_sweetheart.001: I'm going to put a little splinter beside the campfire for every tree I've cut down, separated by day. That way I can tell if I'm getting better at it!
diligent_sweetheart.002: I hope people think callouses on the palms of the hands are attractive.
diligent_sweetheart.004: Chopping is kind of soothing, if you just don't worry too much about the tree falling on you.
diligent_sweetheart.005: I hope we're not disturbing anyone's home. Imagine what it would be like to have your home cut down around you to use to make someone else's home!
diligent_sweetheart.006: I hope trees don't have nerves. This would hurt a lot if they did. If they're screaming for us to stop, it must be on a different frequency.
diligent_sweetheart.007: I was holding my axe today and I realized I could do some real harm if I ever used it on a person, instead of on a tree.

generic.005: Can't take much more of this!
generic.006: My life's starting to flash before my eyes.
generic.008: I should have written my mom more letters.
generic.009: If I get out of this alive, I'm going to write Grandma and tell her I love her.
generic.010: I could use some help here!
generic.013: If I'm going down you're coming with me!
generic.014: For my friends! For my village!
generic.015: I make my last stand here!

generic.003: This seems like a pretty sheltered spot.
generic.005: Nothing much to do today but enjoy life!
generic.007: It's great being here with friends and family.
generic.008: Settling here was a great idea.
generic.009: Feeling happy with a good day's work!
generic.010: This really feels like a spot where we can build something great.
generic.011: Uninterrupted bliss! I love days like this.
generic.013: A whole day without a single existential threat! Amazing!

dead_friend.001: [name(entry.dead_friend)]? Nothing will ever be the same without you.
dead_friend.003: Goodbye, [name(entry.dead_friend)]. I hope we meet again someday.
dead_friend.004: [name(entry.dead_friend)]? But... what will I tell your dad, when I next write home?
dead_friend.005: We can't let [name(entry.dead_friend)]'s death be in vain, people!
dead_friend.008: I can't believe [name(entry.dead_friend)] is really gone.
dead_friend.009: [name(entry.dead_friend)]? Gone? Suddenly this whole thing seems like it wasn't worth it, somehow.
dead_friend.010: Gee, now I really wish I hadn't talked [name(entry.dead_friend)] into this adventure.

diligent_sweetheart.004: If I can't see it, maybe it can't see me?

belaguered_leader.003: They're too strong for us! Scatter, everyone!!

generic.000: Scared out of my gourd now!!!

hopeless_optimist.001: I can't see you!! I can't see you!!!
hopeless_optimist.003: Auugh! Can't we just be friends??
hopeless_optimist.004: Running away so tomorrow can be another daaaaaayyy!!!
hopeless_optimist.005: Run, run, run away from the scary monsters!!!
hopeless_optimist.006: I don't think it wants to be frieeendss!!!

lovable_rogue.000: Grab the goods and head for the hills!
lovable_rogue.001: Please, I don't want to die!
lovable_rogue.002: I have so many more things I need to do!!!!

insufferable_academic.000: I wonder if anyone else has the dream where their clothes trail their bodies by several feet? Lucky for me, I always seem to have on my trusty pair of shiny knickers.
insufferable_academic.001: Last night I dreamed I stood before a class of attentive raccoons. They took notes on the nature of reality. Afterwards, we had a stirring debate.
insufferable_academic.002: According to the formulae in my dreams, determinism is a myth. Time to get breakfast.
insufferable_academic.003: I dreamed of times present, past and future. My consciousness expanded to fill the universe. I was all, everything was me.
insufferable_academic.004: I dreamed I was the trees in the forest, the water in the lake, and the wind in the air.
insufferable_academic.005: I dreamed I was immortal, without beginning or end.
insufferable_academic.006: I dreamed I was between light and dark, space and time.

lovable_rogue.000: This morning, I woke up certain that wolves had stolen all the sheep. Need to build walls! Thicker walls!
lovable_rogue.001: I dreamed of a mine full of gold.
lovable_rogue.002: I had a dream where, of all things, a crocodile, stole all our food. Then he took it to a boat and stayed there
lovable_rogue.003: In my dream last night, I turned everything--and everyone--I touched, into gold. Oops.
lovable_rogue.004: I dreamed that I ate all our food supplies. Best try to avoid doing that today.

teacher.000: I had the dream about fragile ladders again. I wish I knew what was at the top. I'm sure [str(entry.teacher)] is trying to tell me something.

hopeless_optimist.000: Wolves! All night I dreamed I was being chased by wolves!
hopeless_optimist.001: Rabbits! All night I dreamed I was being chased by rabbits!
hopeless_optimist.002: I love dreams about flying. Tonight I flew by soft clouds and over dense trees. Watch out, birds!
hopeless_optimist.003: I dreamed I was a goblin. Don't tell anyone, but stealing from the town was a lot of fun! (Does that make me a bad person?)
hopeless_optimist.004: I dreamed I was cooking soup for everyone but I ran out of salt. Salt's a rock, right? Can you substitute rocks for salt?
hopeless_optimist.005: I dreamt a little bird alighted upon my shoulder and told me that today was going to be a great day. I can't wait!
hopeless_optimist.006: I had a dream that in the distant future, the sons of goblins and the sons of hearthlings sat down together at the table of berries.

diligent_sweetheart.000: Whoa! I was out for a while! Do we still have all our hammers?
diligent_sweetheart.001: Oops! I must've fallen asleep! Do we still have all our trees?
diligent_sweetheart.002: I dreamed I fell asleep for a thousand years. Luckily, someone made me a shiny glass coffin with a hatch on the inside for opening. Weird.
diligent_sweetheart.003: I had a Dream where a Giant Dragon approached me! But when she opened her mouth, only kitten noises came out. Adorable!
diligent_sweetheart.004: I had a dream where I all the forest creatures and I were having a picnic, but the raccoon stole all the honey so we had nothing to put on our bread and butter.
diligent_sweetheart.005: I dreamt that everyone was jeering at me. I ran home and didn't move. Ever again.
diligent_sweetheart.006: I dreamt of a world of lush forests, and clear rivers, surrounded by friends. I woke and it was real!
diligent_sweetheart.007: I dreamt about doing all my chores. Now I've woken I have to do them all over again...

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: Went to sleep hungry again last night and dreamed for ten consecutive hours about poyo pot pie! Raaargh! Fear my devouring mouth!
psychopathic_misanthrope.001: In heaven, I hope I get a lake of poyo pot pie to swim in. Swim forever!
psychopathic_misanthrope.002: I dreamed about eating my fellow Hearthlings. They tasted like Poyo.
psychopathic_misanthrope.003: I dreamed I was a goblin. I never had to work! I just stole what I needed and started fires. That was fun!
psychopathic_misanthrope.004: I dreamed I was back at home, and not in the woods with THESE people...

generic.000: First, I dreamed that I found a shiny mirror under my pillow. Then, goblins were attacking our caravan.
generic.001: I dreamed I built a ladder into the sky! But then someone tore it down and left me up there. It was scary.
generic.002: I dreamed that I WAS the tree being chopped down!
generic.003: I dreamed about a creature with a bill of a duck and the tail of a beaver.
generic.004: I dreamed that it was night time and outside of our village, there were some loud noises. Upon investigation of the fields to the south, I saw a large, black object with two circles and a bunch of dancing animals!
generic.005: I dreamed my friends left me on the roof of a newly constructed building.
generic.006: I dreamed I was at a lake and a luminous rabbit appeared out of the water and told me some great advice. "If you build it they will come."
generic.007: I dreamed my hammer was running after me
generic.008: I dreamed we were racing the sheep. Something to try tomorrow?
generic.009: I dreamed I couldn't stop filling my backpack with all the items littered on the ground.
generic.010: Last night I had this dream where I was attacked by a swarm of poyos.
generic.011: I had a dream that everyone could only collect berries. There weren't even trees to chop or blocks of stone to mine.
generic.012: I dreamed I ate berries until I turned purple and then rolled away into a pond.
generic.013: I dreamed that I was at the mercy of a sickness that turned me into a Zombie. The worst part: I could only walk very very slowly.
generic.014: Last night I dreamed I was stranded in a hole all night and no one would build a ladder for me to climb up.
generic.015: I dreamed that all the animals plotted against us and took over the town.
generic.016: I dreamed that poyos rained from the sky.
generic.017: I dreamed that a giant man-bunny threatened me with a spear!
generic.018: I dreamed I found a mighty hammer that only I could lift.
generic.019: I dreamed I was a vegetable and I planted myself so I can grow taller.
generic.020: In my dream last night, I told everyone carrots made them see in the dark. This morning, we ran out of carrots. Weird!
generic.021: I dreamed that I was no longer tethered to this realm, and I drifted from plane to plane.
generic.022: I had a dream that people buried me and made me into a tree.
generic.023: I dreamed the trees could talk.
generic.024: I dreamed I spoke to a rock, but it was stone cold towards me.
generic.025: I dreamed that one of the ancient trees came alive and attacked our town! It was horrible.
generic.026: I dreamed about a time where houses didn't have roofs. It was very cold.
generic.027: I dreamed that I walked across a vast treeless plain and all I could hear was the sounds of the wind in my ears. Bones of some large horned animal dotted the landscape. I felt so alone.
generic.028: I dreamed that I could walk underwater without holding my breath.
generic.029: I dreamed I was stuck in a maze. I had to run through it with the others.
generic.030: I had a dream that ants were as tall as trees!
generic.031: I dreamed I discovered my magical powers, and I saved my fellow Hearthlings from certain annihilation.
generic.032: I dreamed I was a hero with a poyo partner. We defeat the goblins and become famous!
generic.033: I dreamed of defending the town from a horde of angry farm animals.
generic.034: I dreamed I met a poyo that could talk. It kept saying its name was BuckBuck.
generic.035: I had a dream where I found an ancient sword in a deep crypt. When I reached out to touch it, it faded away and a mournful bell sounded. All went dark.
generic.036: I had a dream that a wizard came to my door and asked me to join them on a journey!
generic.037: I had a dream that I was next in line to become a farmer.
generic.038: I dreamed a giant pumpkin was rolling toward me and I couldn't move.
generic.039: I dreamed about creating an apple coated with gold.
generic.040: I dreamed we lived in a giant castle and I needed to clean it. I prefer to live in the woods!
generic.041: I dreamed that I caught a fish the size of a titan!
generic.042: I dreamed I encountered a were-sheep. It didn't end well.
generic.043: I had a dream about riding a dragon. Aspirational!
generic.044: I dreamed about a land that was lower than the sea yet it was still dry.
generic.045: I dreamed of meeting nomads who spoke a foreign tongue. I couldn't understand a word they said.
generic.046: I dreamed I had no arms.
generic.047: I dreamed that I battered some poyo meat and put it in oil. Poyo nuggets they called it!
generic.048: I dreamed that cloth could be a color other than blue
generic.049: I had a dream where the traders were really bandits! We lost everything.
generic.050: I dreamed I was being chased by a herd of stampeding mammoths.
generic.051: I dreamed I was surrounded by food of all kinds, and I never had to move.
generic.052: I dreamed I was the first Hearthling step onto the moon. It was a small step.
generic.053: I dreamed the sheep made wonderful music, with dancing lights in the air. We partied all night.
generic.054: I dreamed that the moon was smiling at us.
generic.055: I dreamed that I had to catch all the critters in the land.
generic.056: I dreamed about buildings as high as the sky itself.
generic.057: I dreamed it was dangerous to go into the woods alone. I'd better take a sword.
generic.058: I once dreamed I held a magnificent sword. Though once I firmly grasped its handle, it turned to sand.
generic.059: I dreamed I ate bread; I woke up to eat my pillow.
generic.060: I dreamed I became king after pulling a sword out of a rock.
generic.061: I dreamed about a man with a box who could travel in time and space. It was bigger on the inside.
generic.062: I dreamed that dragons were real and we could tame them. Crazy dream!
generic.063: I dreamed everywhere I went, a little goblin followed me. When I turned around to catch him he darted off into the trees.
generic.064: I had a dream where there were eggs all over the ground and I had to step ever so carefully around them.
generic.065: I dreamed I was eating poyo pot pie ... it tasted good.
generic.066: Last night I dreamed that someone was reading my diary. Creepy.
generic.067: I dreamed of creatures of immeasurable power surrounding us. They were actually poyo.
generic.068: I dreamed my sword would glow blue when there were goblins nearby.
generic.069: I dreamed that we fried up strips of fatty, salted meat from a tusked animal we hunted in the forest. It was the most delicious thing I ever ate! I think I'll call it ... "bacon".
generic.070: I dreamed I had a pretty little poyo whom I loved very much. I made it a little bonnet to wear on its head!
generic.071: I had a dream in which ground shook and rumbled. The earth swallowed all our poyo.
generic.072: I dreamed a squirrel chopped our house down to build its tree.
generic.073: I had a dream in which a mighty warrior taught us how to shoot people in the knees with arrows.
generic.074: I had a dream in which I was being baked into a giant pot pie.
generic.075: I had a dream in which goblins were attacking our town, but all our weapons were replaced with corn, and our armor was made of feathers sewn together.
generic.076: I had a dream in which all we could grow out of the ground were swords. We sold the swords in order to buy food.
generic.077: I had a dream where I was chewing grass in the sheep pen, yet I was still a human.
generic.078: I had a dream in which the dwarves were hoarding our socks.
generic.079: I had a dream in which I thought I was a Poyo. I woke up outside the coop. Hm.
generic.080: I had a dream that was very good, but I forgot what it was
generic.081: I had that reoccurring nightmare about the berries again!
generic.082: In my dream from last night, all the jerky in the stockpile became a monster. It was a jerk to everyone.
generic.083: I had a dream in which I was able to make flour at a cauldron by weaving my hand together as if though I were knitting.
generic.084: I had a dream in which we had to import all our corn from some far-flung and distant land.
generic.085: I had a dream I was a wolf hunting poyos! When I awoke I had a feather in my mouth. Weird!
generic.086: I had a dream about a city of gold!
generic.087: I had a dream about a magic bean that could be brewed into a potion, known as coffee, and had the ability to, seemingly, raise the dead back to life.
generic.088: I had the craziest dream! There was a man, who was able to raise magma out of the earth! That's not possible, right!?
generic.089: I had a dream where everything was made of paper and wood! We had to use sticks to prop ourselves up.
generic.090: I had a dream in which a sheep bit me, and turned me into a sheep! But I could still talk. It was weird.
generic.091: I had a dream in which I was tiny, and a portly man said he was going to "Boil em, mash em, stick em in a stew!" Although I awoke before anything else could happen, I assumed he was talking about me.
generic.092: I dreamed about catching a giant fish! From a puddle!
generic.093: I had a dream where the tree I was chopping transformed into a giant and attacked me!
generic.094: I had a dream where I was bullying a poyo and then a swarm of poyo's started attacking me! ... I am now a changed Hearthling
generic.095: I had a dream, in which I was peacefully dosing off. The version of myself in that dream was also having a dream about me peacefully dosing off. This went on and on until I woke up.
generic.096: I had a dream where I ate so much food I literally transformed into a planet.

teacher.000: I dreamed I came upon [str(entry.teacher)] herding rabbits towards a cave.
teacher.001: I had a dream that [str(entry.teacher)] spoke to me through a plushie toy rabbit?! I think I need to stop eating these berries.

beleaguered_leader.000: Last night I counted sheep to get to sleep, and when I woke up, I realized that all night my dreams were about counting sheep. Joy.
beleaguered_leader.001: I had a dream where I saw myself standing in some kind of sun-god robes on a pyramid. I had a thousand hearthlings as subjects, but they were all screaming and throwing radishes at me.
beleaguered_leader.002: I dreamed that me and my friends lived to build a mighty empire of our own!
beleaguered_leader.003: I dreamed that I pushed an immense boulder up a hill. When I reached the top of the hill I watched the boulder roll back down to the bottom. I then started pushing the boulder back up the hill. This happened all night long...
beleaguered_leader.004: I had a horrible dream! I had a dream, where there were 6 other people, and we were all stuck in the- oh, wait.... that wasn't a dream.

teacher_dreams.000: First, I dreamed that the trees grew arms and legs and began to sing. Then, [str(entry.teacher)] asked me to sing in front of a large audience.

generic.000: It feels good to have my own bed.
generic.001: Sleeping in a bed is a ton cooler than sleeping on the floor!
generic.002: Beds are the best invention since regulation log sizes.
generic.003: I'm never going to get tired of sleeping in a bed.
generic.004: Yes! This bed is mine! M-I-N-E!
generic.005: Being in my bed makes me feel so sheltered and cozy.
generic.006: Home is where your bed is.

generic.000: Sleeping on the ground makes me super sore.
generic.001: I think there was a rock in my shoulder all night.
generic.002: Rattlesnakes! What if I wake up covered in rattlesnakes?!
generic.003: I wish I could sleep in a real bed.
generic.004: Any kind of bed would be better than sleeping on the ground
generic.005: I really, really wish I had a bed to call my own.
generic.006: I was too exhausted to find a proper bed, and now I'm really paying for it. Ow.
generic.007: Slept on the ground again. Neck super sore. Everything looks slanted.
generic.008: I counted beds to go to sleep. BEDS!

teacher.000: Though [str(entry.teacher)] slept on the ground during their pilgrimage, I wish I didn't have to.

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: Huh. These berries are actually kind of growing on me. They've got that fresh, non-manured taste.
psychopathic_misanthrope.001: I'm not sure. These berries me feel kind of... light inside. I don't like where this is going.
psychopathic_misanthrope.002: Now I know why hippies are vegetarian. Screw this.

insufferable_academic.000: Dark colored berries are full of antioxidants. Which are good for you.

hopeless_optimist.000: Wow! I get to eat all the fresh berries I want! I'll never go hungry again!
hopeless_optimist.001: I love how they make my mouth blue. And my tongue. And my insides. And--
hopeless_optimist.002: Every berry tastes a little different. Like snowflakes, but for the mouth!
hopeless_optimist.003: I'm getting really good at telling which berries are the crunchiest.

beleaguered_leader.000: Mmm, berries! Part of a healthy, regular diet.
beleaguered_leader.001: Berries again! Which is good, because they're healthy for you.
beleaguered_leader.002: Berries! They taste better than starving.
beleaguered_leader.003: Have you eaten your berries today? I know I've eaten mine!
beleaguered_leader.004: I wonder what's for dinner? I know--BERRIES!
beleaguered_leader.005: Everyone's been pretty good about eating so many berries. I try to set a good example.

lovable_rogue.000: I should really stop trying to sneak these berries into my pockets. If I keep it up somebody might notice the large purple stains in my pants.

teacher.000: In theory, you can ferment fruit, right? By *[str(entry.teacher)]* I miss fermented drinks.

diligent_sweetheart.000: Mmm, berries! You never got fresh fruit in the city.
diligent_sweetheart.001: If we could just build an iron stove, I could make a pie. Well, if I also had butter. And flour. And sugar.

flavor_fatigue.text: On Eating the Same Thing Repeatedly:

generic.001: If I eat one more [str(entry.recent_food)] I might throw up.
generic.002: Wish I had something else to eat other than this [str(entry.recent_food)].

insufferable_academic.000: [str(entry.recent_food)] again? If only people could be nourished by knowledge alone.
insufferable_academic.001: A surprising amount of digestion does not seem to happen on a one-food diet.

beleaguered_leader.001: Better chug this [str(entry.recent_food)] down; got to set a good example.
beleaguered_leader.002: [str(entry.recent_food)] definitely tastes better than starving, but...
beleaguered_leader.003: [str(entry.recent_food)] again? I can feel the revolt coming.

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: There's nothing to eat but [str(entry.recent_food)]? 10 days till I kill someone for their meat.
psychopathic_misanthrope.001: I've eaten so much of this food I can taste it in my sleep.
psychopathic_misanthrope.002: If I have to eat one more [str(entry.recent_food)] I swear I will start to foam at the mouth.

diligent_sweetheart.000: More [str(entry.recent_food)]? Maybe we can dry some of it to eat later?
diligent_sweetheart.001: I don't mean to complain, but all I've eaten recently is food like this [str(entry.recent_food)]. It's starting to hurt my mouth.

hopeless_optimist.000: Maybe if I eat enough of this food, I'll turn into it!
hopeless_optimist.002: It's okay, tongue! Just pretend you can't taste the [str(entry.recent_food)].

lovable_rogue.002: The market value for [str(entry.recent_food)] is essentially zero right now.

generic.000: Mmm, I love diversity in my diet.
generic.001: Eating [str(entry.recent_food)] was a nice change of pace.
generic.002: Having different things at mealtimes really synergizes the flavors!
generic.003: [str(entry.recent_food)] tastes better when I haven't had it for a while.

teacher.000: Praise [str(entry.teacher)]! Diversity in food makes me happy.

lovable_rogue.000: Wow, who knew [str(entry.recent_food)] was so incredibly slimming?
lovable_rogue.001: This [str(entry.recent_food)] is the best thing I've eaten in a long time.
lovable_rogue.002: I bet there's a market for food this good. Unless I should keep it all to myself?

teacher.000: This was an amazing [str(entry.recent_food)]. Praise [str(entry.teacher)] and the Church of Plenty!

hopeless_optimist.001: We need to make more food like this [str(entry.recent_food)] so everyone can eat some!
hopeless_optimist.002: Grow grow grow, grow more of this [str(entry.recent_food)].

beleaguered_leader.000: Wow. Who'd have guessed that [str(entry.recent_food)] was a superfood?
beleaguered_leader.002: That [str(entry.recent_food)] was so good I should really prioritize eating more of it.
beleaguered_leader.003: Arr! Now I feel like a superhero!

generic.000: Wow! That [str(entry.recent_food)] made me feel super healthy!
generic.003: This [str(entry.recent_food)] is going to fuel today's great works!

generic.000: Food! The [str(entry.recent_food)] tastes surprisingly good today.
generic.001: Never really valued food like this [str(entry.recent_food)] till we moved out here.
generic.002: Being fed is much, much, much cooler than being hungry.
generic.003: Oh boy! [str(entry.recent_food)]. Tastes good in the tummy.

with_reaction.000: Dear Diary. Today I'm eating: [str(entry.recent_food)]. Mmm!
with_reaction.001: Dear Diary. Today I'm eating: [str(entry.recent_food)]. Food is good.
with_reaction.002: Dear Diary. Today I'm eating: [str(entry.recent_food)]. Wooo!
with_reaction.003: Dear Diary. Today I'm eating: [str(entry.recent_food)]. Happiness.
with_reaction.004: Dear Diary. Today I'm eating: [str(entry.recent_food)]. Joy.
with_reaction.005: Dear Diary. Today I'm eating: [str(entry.recent_food)]. Oh boy!
with_reaction.006: Dear Diary. Today I'm eating: [str(entry.recent_food)]. Delicious
with_reaction.007: Dear Diary. Today I'm eating: [str(entry.recent_food)]. Better than starving!

insufferable_academic.000: Three days have passed since I had a decent philosophical conversation. Trying not to panic. Failing. Trying to keep it in. Succeeding. Mostly.

beleaguered_leader.000: Everyone seems to have gotten here OK! Well... almost everyone...

diligent_sweetheart.000: Wow! This is a lot of great outdoors. Well, time to form strong relationships and build community!

lovable_rogue.000: Well, here we are, I guess. A million miles away from civilization. Great.
lovable_rogue.001: Mom was right. We're all going to get eaten by bears.

hopeless_optimist.000: I'm so psyched to be here, I could polka with joy!!!
hopeless_optimist.001: I'm so psyched to be here, I could yowl with joy!!!
hopeless_optimist.002: I'm so psyched to be here, I could cartwheel with joy!!!
hopeless_optimist.003: I'm so psyched to be here, I could dance with joy!!!
hopeless_optimist.004: I'm so psyched to be here, I could jump with joy!!!
hopeless_optimist.005: I'm so psyched to be here, I could skip with joy!!!
hopeless_optimist.006: I'm so psyched to be here, I could backflip with joy!!!

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: At the time, wilderness seemed better than jailtime, but I'm starting to wonder.
psychopathic_misanthrope.001: Walk a thousand miles to get away from people and... there are still people. Spork.

generic.001: Yup. Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Good stuff to have on hand.
generic.002: Yup. Time to get a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Here goes!
generic.006: Whoa. Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! I guess I'll try not to make a mess.
generic.007: Ok! Another [str(entry.gather_target)]! I guess I'll try not to make a mess.
generic.008: Ok! Time to get a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Here goes!
generic.009: Ok! Time to get a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Here goes!
generic.013: Ok! Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Here goes!
generic.014: Ok! [str(entry.gather_target)]. I guess I'll try not to make a mess.
generic.017: Yup. Time to get a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Off to work!
generic.018: Whoa. Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Yaaay?
generic.019: Ok! [str(entry.gather_target)]. Good stuff to have on hand.
generic.020: Uh huh. Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Yaaay!
generic.021: Yup. Another [str(entry.gather_target)]! Good stuff to have on hand.
generic.022: Yup. Time to get a [str(entry.gather_target)]! I guess I'll try not to make a mess.
generic.023: Uh huh. Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Yaaay?
generic.024: Yup. Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Yaaay?
generic.025: Uh huh. Time to get a [str(entry.gather_target)]!
generic.026: Uh huh. Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Off to work!
generic.027: Ok! Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Here goes!
generic.028: Uh huh. Time to get a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Good stuff to have on hand.
generic.030: Uh huh. Another [str(entry.gather_target)]! I guess I'll try not to make a mess.
generic.031: Ok! Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Here goes!
generic.032: Uh huh. Today I'll be gathering a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Here goes!

hopeless_optimist.004: Oooh! Time to get a [str(entry.gather_target)]! Forward!

insufferable_academic.000: Fasting for a day merely offers an opportunity to observe the wailings of my monkey mind.
insufferable_academic.001: A day without food is an excellent way to sharpen the mind.
insufferable_academic.002: According to my research, people need to consume at least twenty four units of energy each day to maintain proper function.

hopeless_optimist.000: Wow, I went a whole 24 hours without food!
hopeless_optimist.001: No food by midnight? Maybe I can drink moonlight.
hopeless_optimist.002: So hungry... maybe tomorrow we'll find more berries.

beleaguered_leader.000: It's just 24 hours without food. Don't panic.
beleaguered_leader.002: I'm going to dream about food tonight.
beleaguered_leader.003: A whole day without food? Mustn't complain; got to set a good example.

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: A whole day without food? My stomach is going to start eating itself.
psychopathic_misanthrope.001: Went a whole day without eating a single thing. Tomorrow, my 'friends' had better watch out.
psychopathic_misanthrope.002: I may not have eaten all day today, but I'm still a badass.
psychopathic_misanthrope.003: No food in camp today, huh? Maybe I can find something in the forest to kill tomorrow.

generic.001: I wish I had something to eat.
generic.002: Going a who day without food makes me so, so sad.

diligent_sweetheart.000: It's okay, I don't need to eat every day.
diligent_sweetheart.001: By the precepts of the Church of Plenty, we should eat at least once a day.

teacher.000: A day without food? At home we used to go a whole week for the festival of [str(entry.teacher)]!

lovable_rogue.000: 24 hours without food? I'm sure I could find an opportunity here, if I weren't so hungry.
lovable_rogue.001: Nobody's eaten in a while. I could make a killing if I just had one of mom's apple pies.
lovable_rogue.002: Going without food for a whole day is surprisingly hard.

beleaguered_leader.000: I don't know how long we can last without food.
beleaguered_leader.001: Has anyone found any animals to eat yet?
beleaguered_leader.002: Keep on the lookout for berry bushes, or something!
beleaguered_leader.004: I have to stop dreaming about food every night.

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: Is there anyone around here I can eat?
psychopathic_misanthrope.001: I need to kill something small and furry.

diligent_sweetheart.000: I'm so hungry... Step 1: Learn carpentry!
diligent_sweetheart.001: It's okay, I didn't really need to eat today.
diligent_sweetheart.002: I wish I could bake a cheesecake.
diligent_sweetheart.003: If we huddle around the fire at night, that's almost as good as eating, right?
diligent_sweetheart.004: I really don't want to die here.

teacher.000: [str(entry.teacher)], even if I don't make it, keep my friends safe, okay?

lovable_rogue.000: In retrospect, I really should have hoarded those berries.
lovable_rogue.001: It's a pity you can't eat silver and gold.
lovable_rogue.002: That wood is starting to look like chocolate...

teacher.000: As [str(entry.teacher)] is my witness, I will never go hungry again!

insufferable_academic.000: Hunger is merely a state of mind.
insufferable_academic.001: To be, or not to be, that is the question...
insufferable_academic.002: The needs of the stomach are merely a distraction from the pursuits of the mind.
insufferable_academic.004: I refuse to allow my vast intellect to succumb to base starvation!
insufferable_academic.005: According to my research, people need to consume at least twenty four units of energy each day to maintain proper function.

hopeless_optimist.000: Oh, great! Another day without food... That's exactly that little push I needed for starting my diet!
hopeless_optimist.001: Hunger really sharpens the colors in the world!
hopeless_optimist.002: I think there's a hole in my stomach.

generic.001: If I could just get some food, maybe my stomach would feel better.
generic.002: I don't know how much longer I can go without food.

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: You want me to be the weaver? Everything I know about weaving: jab the pointy end into the other person. This should be interesting.

hopeless_optimist.000: Woo! Now that I'm the weaver, I live to make comfy beds for everyone!

insufferable_academic.000: There is a meditative grace in fine knotwork. Stare, my friends, stare until your souls belong to meeeeee.

beleaguered_leader.000: I don't know... I always expected a more epic role in life. Well, this will probably be good for my blood pressure.

lovable_rogue.000: Hmm... if a spider is a weaver, is a weaver like a spider? Everyone shall sleep safe in my webs. ...Was that too creepy?

diligent_sweetheart.000: Oh! First thing's first--time to make everyone a new winter scarf!

party.description: Organizes troops into groups for combat

insane_alligator.description: Smaller varanuses tend to flock around them.

step005.title: Click X to close this window

step004.title: Click the Craft button to craft the workshop

step001.title: Open the workshop menu
step001.description: Use this menu to manage the various crafting workshops of your citizens.

step000.title: Set Up a Workbench
step000.description: Our carpenter needs a crafting station in order to craft items for the town. Let's make a workbench!

step001.title: Open the Build Menu
step001.description: Use this menu to build structures and place items in your town.

step000.title: Place the Carpenter's Workbench
step000.description: Now that we've crafted the workbench, we need to place it in town for the Carpenter to use.

step003.title: Click the Carpenter's Workshop item
step003.description: Select the workshop and click to place it somewhere in town.

step000.title: Congratulations!
step000.description: We've got resources, a place to store goods, and a way to craft items. We're well on our way to getting this settlement off the ground!

scenario_data.declined_text: I don't need a tutorial -- I know what to do!

food_for_days.description: The large amount of food crammed into the back of the caravan should keep the hearthlings going for a handful of days while they get their settlement up and running.
food_for_days.tooltip: A safe option for new players, though lacking in defense.

merchant_caravan.description: A collection of trade tools should give the settlement a leg up in the wilderness.
merchant_caravan.tooltip: A good collection of craft skills, but short on food.

money_solves_all_problems.description: Anything that the town needs they should be able to purchase from a trader.  That is, presuming one finds them and has the proper goods for sale...
money_solves_all_problems.tooltip: A risky but potentially very beneficial choice.  It all depends on when and what traders arrive.

animal_companion_trait.description: Ever since [name(i18n_data.savior)] [str(i18n_data.maybe_determiner)] [str(i18n_data.maybe_savior_species)] saved their [str(i18n_data.savee_species)], [name(i18n_data.savee)], from mortal danger, they've been inseparable.

herbivore_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] is a friend to all animals! Plants, less so.

callous_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] never really connects with others. This helps them to not be as hurt when a tragedy strikes, but their constant guarded composure makes them slow to make friends.

carnivore_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] just LOVES animals! Especially with hot sauce.

courageous_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves to save others, and puts the safety of the town as paramount.

excitable_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] can never seem to keep their emotions in check, so they become happy or sad much faster than normal.

green_thumb_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] seems to have a way with plants that is somewhat indescribable.

heart_of_a_crafter_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves crafting things for others. If they don't make at least one thing a day, they feel the day is wasted.

professor_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] will help people gain experience in the basics of their class, though their explanations tend to be a bit... long winded.

featherweight_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] likes to walk a bit faster than others, except if they are carrying something, which causes them to slow down greatly.

pack_mule_trait.description: This hearthling loves to haul things around! For inexplicable reasons, they move faster when they are carrying something in their pack.

glutton_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)]'s stomach might as well be a portal to another world for as much as they're able to eat. Maybe that explains a bit of their resilience, though.

hothead_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] never voluntarily backs down from a fight. Even from ones they probably should...

night_owl_trait.description: The day only really begins once the sun has set.

optimistic_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] always looks on the bright side, and sees a silver lining in almost everything.

passion_job_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] always dreamed of being a [str(i18n_data.passion_job)], maybe now they'll get their chance?

pessimistic_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] is a glass half-empty kinda person.

cultist_trait.description: This hearthling keeps mumbling about some sort of secret "bunny god" sleeping eternally. What's that about?

jokester_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves to tell jokes. Are they good? It's tough to say, but they frequently seem to leave others with a smile.

charismatic_trait.description: When [name(i18n_data.entity)] walks into a room, people always take notice.

gregarious_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves discussing the day's events with others and gets a bit lonely when they don't.

loner_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] doesn't really care for the company of others. They prefer to be by themselves.

empathetic_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] is really sensitive to the mood of the town, and it always seems to rub off on them.

opinionated_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] has an opinion on everything, and isn't shy about sharing it.

magnificent_beard_trait.description: This hearthling has a truly magnificent beard.

stoic_trait.description: Due to their even temperament, it takes a lot to make this Hearthling happy or sad.

gourmand_trait.description: Only the tastiest of foods are welcome to [name(i18n_data.entity)]'s palate. They become happy when they eat higher quality food, but low quality meals are quite distasteful.

goat_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] will basically eat anything. They are not picky at all, sometimes to the disgust of those around them.

pluviophile_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves nothing more than the gentle drumbeat of raindrops.

storm_chaser_trait.description: Thunderstorms, sandstorms, blizzards, [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves them all!

hungry.tooltip: I could really go for a good meal.

famished.tooltip: It's been awhile since I've eaten. I really need some food!

starving.tooltip: My stomach is in knots!  If I don't find something to eat soon...

stuffed.tooltip: My last meal was so filling I won't need to eat again for a bit.

spacious.tooltip: There's so much open space around here. It really makes me feel at ease.

cramped.tooltip: I'm feeling rather cramped. I always have to watch my step not to bump into anything.

very_cramped.tooltip: This place is suffocating! There's barely room to breathe!

dark.tooltip: This area isn't very well lit.

pain_scratched.tooltip: I'm a little worse for wear.

slept_on_ground.tooltip: My back is killing me from having slept on the ground. When are we going to get some decent beds?

slept_in_shared_bed.tooltip: I'm sharing my bed with someone else right now. It's not the worst, but I really wish I had my own.

slept_in_shared_room.tooltip: I'm sharing my room with someone else right now. I could use a little more privacy.

well_rested.tooltip: Ahh, sleeping in my own bed without hearing other people snoring always leaves me refreshed.

slept_outside.tooltip: I wish I had some shelter and protection from the elements.

slept_in_comfy_bed.tooltip: My bed is really comfortable. I almost didn't want to leave it!

ate_unpalatable.tooltip: Eating [str(foodname)] was one of the poorer choices I made today.

herbivore_ate_meat.tooltip: I can't believe I ate a [str(foodname)].  I can just imagine how cute it must have looked... before...

carnivore_ate_veggies.tooltip: There's been a mistake.  I've accidentally eaten food that my food eats.

offended_palate.tooltip: Bleh, I hate eating stuff like [str(foodname)]. There's just no "zazz" to it!

pleased_palate.tooltip: Mmm, my my. I really should tell the others how good [str(foodname)] was today!

ate_fine.tooltip: My recent meal was amazing! Whoever made the [str(foodname)] really put their heart into it.

ate_tasty.tooltip: The [str(foodname)] I ate was pretty tasty! I still remember the combination of flavors.

ate_raw.tooltip: I recently ate a raw [str(foodname)]. I can only imagine how much better it would have tasted were it cooked.

ate_bland.tooltip: I remember eating a bland [str(foodname)]. It gave me the strength to keep going, but the meal was so boring.

ate_item_quality_fine.tooltip: My recent [str(foodname)] was <font color='#6be9e7'>Finely</font> prepared, which made it extra delicious!

ate_item_quality_excellent.tooltip: My recent [str(foodname)] was <font color='#ce71d2'>Excellent!</font> It was really something!

ate_item_quality_masterwork.tooltip: I just ate a <font color='#E3AC53'>Masterfully</font> prepared [str(foodname)]! I never knew it could taste so good!

ate_cooked.tooltip: I always enjoy the 'warm belly' feeling after a nice prepared meal.

helped_out.tooltip: Wow, the Amberstone warren was amazing! I feel so honored to have helped them out.

harvested_bramble.tooltip: Feels good to do my part, taking an axe to this Titan's corrupt undergrowth!

harvested_root.display_name: Chopped down a Root of Evil
harvested_root.tooltip: That's one step closer to kicking this Titan out for good!

titan_victory.tooltip: We did it! The air seems cleaner now, and I don't feel like there's always something watching me...

no_more_titan.tooltip: It feels nice to live in a place without an ancient darkness lurking below it for once!

pioneering_spirit.tooltip: We've left our home to build a new one. We will make it better than before!

settling_in.tooltip: I'm starting to feel at home, but there's work yet to be done.

level_2.tooltip: We've been recognized as a fully fledged settlement!  Our work is starting to pay off.

lack_of_safety.tooltip: Without some form of city guard, I just don't feel at ease in this wilderness.

petty_theft.tooltip: Someone stole something from our supplies! We need better defenses.

outpost.tooltip: We've just established an Outpost! Time to get working on it!

settlement.tooltip: Our outpost is now a fully-fledged Settlement! Hurrah!

town.tooltip: We've been recognized as a Town! Our work is starting to pay off!

tired.tooltip: It's been awhile since I've slept.

exhausted.tooltip: It feels like forever since I've slept.. I can barely keep my eyes open.

fatigued.tooltip: I've been on my feet for too long. I really need some time to sleep.

panicked.tooltip: I'm not proud of how I acted when the monsters came, but it's all I could think to do.

misses_pet.tooltip: Although it's been awhile since they died, I still catch myself sometimes looking for my pet, [str(pet_name)].

plant_lover.tooltip: Every time I interact with plants I feel a bit calmer.

fruitful_labors.tooltip: It always feels good to make something with one's own hands. It helps clear my mind.

idle_hands.tooltip: I've not made anything in awhile and feel like a layabout. Isn't there something I can craft?

protected_the_town.tooltip: We fended off a group of nasties recently, it really got my blood pumping!

loves_their_job.tooltip: This is the perfect job for me! I love what I do day to day.

inspired.tooltip: [str(target_name)] is in quite good spirits today. They're really pleasant to be around!

discouraged.tooltip: Sheesh, [str(target_name)] is no fun when they're in a bad mood.

lonely.tooltip: It's been awhile since I've talked to anyone. I really need to get some stuff off my chest.

enjoys_company.tooltip: It's always great to spend some time with my fellow town members.

annoyed_with_others.tooltip: Why do these people keep talking to me? It keeps distracting me from what's important.

alone_with_thoughts.tooltip: Being away from others has given me the time to reflect and clear my mind.

everyone_worse_off.tooltip: Seeing everyone else in worse spirits just brings me down.

everyone_happier.tooltip: Everyone else seems to be in a better mood than me. Maybe I should look at things differently.

ate_not_bad_food.tooltip: My [str(foodname)] today was a little tasty, but didn't seem that different from what I normally eat.

ate_some_food.tooltip: I had some [str(foodname)] today. It was alright, but I don't see what the big deal is.

townmember_died.tooltip: A fellow townmember has died. If only we had been more watchful!

pet_died.tooltip: My poor [str(pet_name)] passed away recently. I'll miss them quite a bit.

saved_from_mortal_wounds.tooltip: I would have died back there were it not for those around me! I'm grateful for this second chance.

gained_a_level.tooltip: I've been at this job long enough to gain a new insight! I can feel myself becoming better at my work.

great_talk.tooltip: Talking with [str(target_name)] today was really nice.

great_joke.tooltip: Hahaha, just thinking of the joke [str(target_name)] told makes me crack up!

tough_crowd.tooltip: [str(target_name)] didn't laugh at my joke. Was it really that bad?

nuzzled.tooltip: Awww, my pet [str(target_name)] always manages to cheer me up.

booped.tooltip: A cute [str(species)] booped me today. It made me feel warm and fuzzy inside.

horrendous.tooltip: Everywhere I look I see something terrible!

beautiful.tooltip: The decor around here is really great. A lot of hard work must have gone into making it look this nice.

ugly.tooltip: Sheesh, it's really ugly around here. We definitely can make this look better!

pleasing.tooltip: It's pretty nice looking around here.

breathtaking.tooltip: Wow, everywhere I look is gorgeous! The attention to detail is amazing!
I love crafting in my workshop; it's so well decorated!

pleasing.tooltip: A well-maintained work space brightens my mood.

beautiful.tooltip: The area around my workbench is looking good, everything is in its place.

ugly.tooltip: It's frustrating that my work space is so grungy.

awe_inspiring.tooltip: My workshop looks so amazing! It's an inspiration!

pleasing.tooltip: Where I slept last night was pretty nice.

beautiful.tooltip: My bedroom is really shaping up; I like it!

breathtaking.tooltip: I love sleeping in such a wonderful bedroom!

awe_inspiring.tooltip: When I went to bed last night, I felt like royalty.

beautiful.tooltip: I was happy to eat in such an attractive spot!

breathtaking.tooltip: Someone really spent some effort decorating our dining room!

awe_inspiring.tooltip: The decor was so great, dinner was a feast for both my eyes and my stomach!

pleasing.tooltip: It was nice to eat my meal in a comfortable space.

ugly.tooltip: The ugly surroundings made it difficult to enjoy my last meal.

windy_positive.tooltip: The breeze is caressing my skin.

blizzard_negative.tooltip: Oh, the weather outside is frightful!

thunderstorm_negative.tooltip: That lightning bolt almost hit me!

sunny_positive.tooltip: Endless sunshine, warmth, and blue skies.

cloudy_positive.tooltip: Overcast skies: perfect for lazing around on the porch.

sunny_negative.tooltip: I have to shield my eyes just to walk outside. And don't get me started on the sunburn!

thunderstorm_positive.tooltip: It's so exciting to hear the thunder rolling in!

windy_negative.tooltip: The wind outside is biting at my skin.

blizzard_positive.tooltip: That fierce blizzard outside makes this a day to remember!

rain_positive.tooltip: The drip, drip, drip of the raindrops is soothing all my worries!

rain_negative.tooltip: I almost stepped in a puddle. Now my feet are cold.

lucky.tooltip: Something good is going to happen today. I just feel it!

snow_negative.tooltip: Brrr! I can barely feel my toes.

sandstorm_negative.tooltip: The sands are blowing across the landscape. Hide your poyos! Hide your sheep!

snow_positive.tooltip: The world is hushed and white with snow.

foggy_negative.tooltip: Was that a goblin skulking around in the fog?

foggy_positive.tooltip: I wonder what wonders lie beneath that mysterious mist.

sandstorm_positive.tooltip: The sands always come to test our fortitude... Mine is unwavering.

titanstorm_negative.display_name: The End Times are Upon Us!
titanstorm_negative.tooltip: The Titan's gonna destroy everything! Run for your lives!

titanstorm_positive.tooltip: We're stronger than some 'Titan'! The evil monster's big, and it's scary, but I believe in our town!!

sandy_negative.tooltip: Oh no... I have sand and dust everywere!  It's in my eyes!

snow_sunny_positive.tooltip: The snow is glistening from the winter sun.

rain_sunny_positive.tooltip: The sun is shimmering through the rain drops...

snow_sunny_negative.tooltip: I am freezing! And the sunshine reflecting off the snow too is bright!

rain_sunny_negative.tooltip: This would have been a perfect day, if not for the rain.

sandy_positive.tooltip: The dust storms remind us of the cycle of life...

koda.tooltip: An adorable little ghost kitten wanted some scritches!

jacko.tooltip: I saw a spectral panther!  It protected the town from danger!

windy.description: Howling winds and roaring gales sweep the lands.

thunderstorm.description:
Thunder rolled... It rolled a six.
  • Plant growth speed is slightly increased.
  • Vision radius is reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings sometimes get hit by lightning.
  • The ground and trees sometimes get hit by lightning.

sunny.description: Yet another day of endless sunshine and blue skies.

snow.description:
Cold, frost, and sunshine: day of wonder! Why are you, friend, still deep in slumber?
  • Plant growth speed is reduced.
  • Vision radius is slightly reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too cold to work as effectively.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are hurt by the cold.

snow_sunny.description:
What a beautiful winter wonderland it is today!
  • Plant growth speed is reduced.
  • Vision radius is only slightly reduced.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too cold to work as effectively.
  • Unsheltered pasture animals are hurt by the cold.

sandstorm.description:
Cover your eyes. Cover your ears. In fact, just stay inside.
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too hot to work as effectively.
  • Vision radius is slightly reduced.
  • Clouds of sand pass across the landscape, destroying crops and hurting everyone.

sandy_day.description:
There is sand and dust... everywhere!
  • Unsheltered hearthlings are too hot to work as effectively.
  • Vision radius is only slightly reduced.

rain.description:
Water! Water from the skies!
  • Plant growth speed is slightly increased.
  • Vision radius is slightly reduced.

rain_sunny.description:
Its raining, but the sun is peaking out!
  • Plant growth speed is increased.
  • Vision radius is only slightly reduced.

lucky.description:
Today, everything is just a tiny bit better.
  • Hearthlings find all their ailments healed, as if by magic.
  • Hearthlings are slightly luckier in everything they do.

carpenter_description.description: The Carpenter crafts tools and furniture from wood. The tools he makes unlocks several other jobs.

level_6_data.title: Master Carpenter
level_6_data.perk_000_description: The Carpenter's mastery of his trade allows them access to recipes that expand your town's opportunities.

carpenter_saw.description: Tools of the trade for a Carpenter.

carpenter_workbench_ghost.description: Used by the Carpenter for crafting.

hoe_recipe.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Farmer.

cook_description.description: The Cook makes delicious, hearty meals from base vegetables and meats.

workshop.name: Stone Cauldron
workshop.long_description: Humongous, heavy pot, suitable for cooking up a feast at a time!

level_2_data.perk_000_description: The Cook has learned to make slightly fancier recipes.

level_1_data.perk_000_description: The Cook can make basic, nutritious recipes.

level_3_data.perk_000_description: The cook can now make more big, satisfying meat dishes, along with a crusty, savory pot pie.
level_3_data.perk_001_description:
When inspiration strikes, the Cook may now prepare an especially Fine quality of meal.

(Fine meals give an extra happy thought, are scarfed down more quickly, and sell for more!)

level_4_data.perk_000_description: The Cook can now make and work with Sugar.

level_5_data.perk_000_description:
The Cook can now prepare meals of Excellent quality, and will make Fine quality meals more often.

(Excellent meals are eaten even more quickly, give another happy thought, and sell for even more!!)

cook_spoon_iconic.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Cook.

cook_spoon_talisman.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Cook.

cook_workbench_ghost.description: Used by the Cook for delicious recipes.

flour_recipe.description: A necessary ingredient for all kinds of bread.

meat_stew_recipe.description: Hearty, satisfying, and perfect to ease the passing of a cold night.
meat_stew_recipe.flavor: Before you ask, it's an assortment of meats.

veggie_stew_recipe.description: A warm, savory broth, fortified with braised pumpkin!
veggie_stew_recipe.flavor: Afterwards, you feel satisfied, but not heavy.

poyo_pot_pie_recipe.description: A tasty meat and veggie pie.

omelette_recipe.description: Veggies and meat wrapped in egg.

fried_eggs_recipe.flavor: Do you like yours sunnyside up?

sheep_feed_recipe.description: A supplement for a healthy sheep diet

cook_workbench_recipe.description: Use to cook nutritions soups and stews.
cook_workbench_recipe.flavor: Stone, to keep the food hot for a long time.

corn_meal_recipe.description: Corn ground into a fine powder

roast_mutton_recipe.flavor: The traditional meal, excellent with berry sauce!

donation_box_recipe.recipe_name: Donation to the Church of Plenty

donation_box_recipe.flavor: To the hungry, bread, to the driven, faith. --Cid the Wanderer

kibble_recipe.flavor: There is a hole in my heart the shape of a kitten.

bacon_and_eggs_recipe.description: Pork and eggs just like you like 'em.

fried_eggs_large_recipe.description: One HUGE egg fried to order.

bug_meat_stew_recipe.description: Stringy, spicy, and perfect to eat on a hot day.

roast_varanus_recipe.flavor: What a tasty slice of lizard tail!

roast_poultry_large_recipe.flavor: Those legs are good for running.. and eating!

roast_venison_recipe.flavor: Not a common meal, but tasty when you can find it.

sugar_recipe.description: A necessary ingredient for all kinds of sweets.

cake_recipe.description: A tasty Cake made from wheat and sugar.
cake_recipe.flavor: So delicious with a berry on top!

bug_meat_kabob_recipe.description: Bug meat on a stick! Has an interesting texture

roasted_sweet_potato_recipe.flavor: Warms your hands and your heart.

roast_sausage_recipe.flavor: It's some kind of meat, not sure which it was though...

feed_fodder_recipe.flavor: What a great use of excess seeds!

pie_berry_recipe.description: A scrumptious pie that is very complicated to make.

cake_layered_recipe.description: An extremely involved recipe but so good, and so filling...

dumpling_vegetarian_recipe.description: A little bread pocket with veggies and spices stuffed inside.
dumpling_vegetarian_recipe.flavor: A little complicated to make, but fill you up pretty well.

cook_mill_ghost.description: Used by the cook to grind grains into flour.

critter_trap_recipe.description: Deals a small amount of damage and shortly stuns enemies.

diligence_2_buff.description: The engineer can repair doors more efficiently

level_5_data.perk_000_description: The farmer can perform amazing acts of arboreal advancement! (They can grow trees.)

level_1_data.perk_000_description: Running fresh food from field to table has increased the farmer's footspeed.

footman_description.description: The Footman is a melee fighter. A good choice for the backbone of your town's defense.

level_1_data.perk_000_description: The footman knows that all combats may have mortal consequences, and attacks with renewed determination.
